intro: Syngonanthus oblongus var. oblongus, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowering period usually occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Syngonanthus oblongus var. oblongus is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
